page.title: 15SCOUSE - the local dialect.
page.content: In Liverpool we speak a{dialect} called{SCOUSE.}It contains many colloquial expressions that need translating and we also speak very quickly. The following could be a typical conversation in Netherley between two pupils. "Alright Wendy ?{(hello)}Let's bunk off school."{(truant)} "Na...last time I did that me mam{ {(mother)}found out an threw a wobbler."{(She was angry)} "Oh go on, it'll be boss.{(great)} Don't be a grov."{(groveller)} "OK. Lets get some scram{(food)}and go and change this gear.{(clothes)}I feel a right mef{(idiot)}in this uniform." "Sound!{(good)}Hold on, there's slap head from school."{(a bald-headed {teacher)} "No sweat,{(don't worry)}he's a divvy!" {(an incompetent idiot) }
